info.title: Item Management
info.description: The Item Management APIs enable you to set up and manage items on Walmart.com. Once you have completed Registration and have access to your Consumer ID and Private Key, you can get started with the integration process

post.description:
You can update 10,000 items at once; updates with more than 10,000 items are not supported. Keep feed sizes below 10 MB to ensure optimal feed processing time.
You can use the Bulk Item Setup API for any of the following item spec versions, just specify the corresponding feed type as a query parameter. Please ensure the WFS onboarding is complete before using WFS Specs or converting items to WFS
*   Item spec feed type: item
*   WFS Item spec feed type: OMNI_WFSSETUP 
* Item spec feed type for 4.x spec: MP_ITEM_INTL 
*   Convert an existing item to WFS feed type : OMNI_WFSCONVERT

Orderable.shortDescription: Glitter glue pens in a fun mini version V2
Glitter glue pens in a fun mini version V2

    <MPItem>
        <processMode>CREATE</processMode>
        <sku>test_65654345244529</sku>

                        <processorType>
                            <processorTypeValue>test</processorTypeValue>
                        </processorType>
                        <assembledProductWeight>

                        </assembledProductWeight>

                        </plugType>
                    </CellPhones>
                </Electronics>
            </category>
        </MPProduct>
        <MPOffer>
            <price>1000</price>
            <ShippingWeight>

            <ProductTaxCode>10101</ProductTaxCode>

            <sellerWarranty>test</sellerWarranty>

            <shippingCountryOfOrigin>México</shippingCountryOfOrigin>
            <msiEligible>Sí</msiEligible>

    </MPItem>
</MPItemFeed>

get.description: Displays a list of all items by using either nextCursor or offset and limit query parameters

parameters.name: nextCursor
parameters.description: Used for pagination when more than 200 items are retrieved.

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: An arbitrary alphanumeric unique ID, specified by the seller, which identifies each item. This will be used by the seller in the XSD file to refer to each item.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The object response to start with, where 0 is the first entity that can be requested. It can only be used when includeDetails is set to true.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of entities to be returned. It cannot be more than 50 entities. Use it only when the includeDetails is set to true.

get.description: Retrieves an item and displays the item details.

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: An arbitrary alphanumeric unique ID, specified by the seller, which identifies each item. This will be used by the seller in the XSD file to refer to each item.

application\/xml.example:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<ns2:ItemResponses xmlns:ns2="http://walmart.com/">
    <ns2:ItemResponse>
        <ns2:mart>WALMART_MEXICO</ns2:mart>
        <ns2:sku>sku-test3</ns2:sku>
        <ns2:wpid>5I5XS1SDJAQ5</ns2:wpid>
        <ns2:gtin>05662357960175</ns2:gtin>
        <ns2:productName>LG 55\" Class final 1028</ns2:productName>
        <ns2:shelf>UNNAV</ns2:shelf>
        <ns2:price>
            <ns2:currency>MXN</ns2:currency>
            <ns2:amount>17.7</ns2:amount>
        </ns2:price>
        <ns2:publishedStatus>PUBLISHED</ns2:publishedStatus>
    </ns2:ItemResponse>
    <ns2:totalItems>1</ns2:totalItems>
</ns2:ItemResponses>

delete.description: Completely deactivates and un-publishes an item from the site.

application\/xml.example:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<ns2:ItemRetireResponse xmlns:ns2="http://walmart.com/">
    <ns2:sku>sku-test3</ns2:sku>
    <ns2:message>Thank you.  Your item has been submitted for retirement from Walmart Catalog.  Please note that it can take up to 48 hours for items to be retired from our catalog.</ns2:message>
</ns2:ItemRetireResponse>

feedId.description: A unique ID, returned from the Bulk Upload API, used for tracking the feed file

wpid.description: An alphanumeric Product ID generated by Walmart

upc.description: The 12-digit bar code used extensively for retail packaging in the United States

gtin.description: The GTIN-compatible Product ID (i.e. UPC or EAN). UPCs must be 12 or 14 digitis in length. EANs must be 13 digits in length.

productName.description: A seller-specified, alphanumeric string uniquely identifying the product name. Example: 'Sterling Silver Blue Diamond Heart Pendant with 18in Chain'

productType.description: A seller-specified, alphanumeric string uniquely identifying the Product Type. Example: 'Diamond'

publishedStatus.description: The published status of an item describes where the item is in the submission process. Examples of allowed values are PUBLISHED, UNPUBLISHED.

nextCursor.description: Used for pagination when more than 200 items are retrieved. The nextCursor value of the response includes a link to another GET call which retrieves the next page of results.

ItemResponse.description: Items included in the response list

currency.description: The currency of the item price

amount.description: The numerical amount of the price. Example: 9.99

Money.description: The current price of the item

sku.description: An arbitrary alphanumeric unique ID, specified by the seller, which identifies each item.

message.description: Message confirming the deletion or retirement of an item from the Walmart Catalog

authorization.name: Authorization
authorization.description: Basic authorization header. Base 64 encodes the Client ID and Client Secret retrieved in step two of the integration steps.

accessToken.name: WM_SEC.ACCESS_TOKEN
accessToken.description: The access token retrieved in the Token API call

channelType.name: WM_CONSUMER.CHANNEL.TYPE
channelType.description: A unique ID to track the consumer request by channel. Use the Consumer Channel Type received during onboarding

correlationId.name: WM_QOS.CORRELATION_ID
correlationId.description: A unique ID which identifies each API call and used to track and debug issues; use a random generated GUID for this ID

accessToken.description: Header authentication with a Walmart access token, which is automatically generated using your Client ID and Client Secret. The token is valid for 15 minutes, and will be passed in the WM_SEC.ACCESS_TOKEN header

basic.description: Basic authentication with a Walmart Client ID and Client Secret
